location.name: Mountain View, CA: Los Angeles, CA; San Francisco, CA; New York, NY

title: Field Marketer, Field Content & Speaker Strategy
content:
Airtable is looking for a seasoned Field Marketer with extensive experience curating and presenting customer-facing content to be part of our growing Enterprise Field Marketing team.
This is a strategic role that will be crucial for Airtable as we evolve our Enterprise GTM motion, and continue to grow our field marketing strategy with events, webinars, and other customer engagement tactics.
This person will be part of the field marketing team, engaging regularly with product marketing, product group, sales, field marketing managers, marketing operations, and the wider marketing org. They will be responsible for designing a repeatable, scalable field content strategy which will be integrated into events, webinars, account on-sites, account plays, etc, curating the right content to execute that strategy.  
This person will also be responsible for designing and executing Airable’s first internal Speakers Bureau: creating a program framework, getting cross-functional commitment, and identifying and training speakers.
 The right candidate may have a background in product marketing, sales engineering, community, and customer education. Comfort and enjoyment of public speaking are a must.
What you'll do

Develop a field events content strategy, working closely with product marketing, field marketing and sales. Includes field workshops, executive roundtables, webinars, web-based demos, ABM strategies, etc.
Create an internal speaker strategy (ie Speakers Bureau), identifying, training and enabling internal speakers to deliver the right messages in different situations and to different audiences, while getting buy-in from cross functional leaders
Delivering/presenting content yourself both live and virtually to Enterprise prospects / customers and specific accounts, as needed Help develop Airtable’s webinar and online demo content strategy, workly closing with creative, lifecycle, PMM and the Webinar project manager
Be the connective glue between marketing and customer education, helping provide a POV on the content strategy as users make the journey from prospects to Enterprise customers, when they start engaging with scaled education content
Help customize Airtable messaging to make sense for our most strategic accounts, where it will be delivered in account-based events.
Be a liaison between the field (customers/prospects and sales) and Product Marketing, providing a feedback loop between the field and our product and marketing teams.  
Estimated 20% - 30% travel

Who you are

7+ years of experience
Heavy experience building customer-facing presentations, working closing with product marketing and understanding existing product features/functionality, new launches, positioning and GTM strategy
High caliber public speaker, with proof of presentation and public speaking experience (trade shows, podcasts, webinars, etc).  Enthusiasm for engaging with customers that shows
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.  Ability to build collaborative relationships and effectively partner across teams, functions and job levels
Experience building light, high level, product vignettes. Experience educating customers and new features nice to have
Proven end-to-end project management with the ability to organize, prioritize and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment
Open, honest, cooperative, team player who can balance getting the right level of cross functional buy-in with time to market
Bias for action, comfortable with ambiguity, excitement about building new processes and ways of working

Compensation awarded to successful candidates will vary based on their work location, relevant skills and experience. The base salary range for this role is $148,000 - $228,000 for work locations in San Francisco, Mountain View, Seattle, NYC and LA. Our total compensation package also includes the opportunity to receive benefits, restricted stock units, and may include incentive compensation. To learn more about our comprehensive benefit offerings, please check out Life at Airtable.
Airtable is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and strive to create a workplace where everyone has an equal opportunity to thrive. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any characteristic protected by applicable federal and state laws, regulations and ordinances. Learn more about your EEO rights as an applicant. 
VEVRAA-Federal Contractor
If you have a medical condition, disability, or religious belief/practice which inhibits your ability to participate in any part of the application or interview process, please complete our Accommodations Request Form and let us know how we may assist you. Airtable is committed to participating in the interactive process and providing reasonable accommodations to qualified applicants.Please see our Privacy Notice for details regarding Airtable’s collection and use of personal information relating to the application and recruitment process by clicking here.
